quiz.title: Human Intelligence Assessment
quiz.description: Discover your mental clarity and decision-making skills

questions.question: Why does your clarity decrease when you are tired?
options: Brain relies on feeling instead of thinking

questions.question: What typically helps when you're confused?
Why is clarity important to work or study work?
What does clarity do when the mind is messy?
Clarity helps mainly in what?
What part of the brain filters unnecessary information?
Why do clear people seem calmer?
In a team, clarity spreads when—
options: Everyone speaks with reason and listens with care

questions.question: When clarity fades, what usually increases?
You have two good choices. How to decide clearly?
What happens in the brain when you label your feelings clearly?
Which brain habit causes overthinking?
A team misunderstands your plan again and again. Where should clarity start?
Which mental exercise best trains clarity?
Which daily question trains the mind for clarity?
What is the most effective method of starting a clear task?
The habit of writing down one's thoughts is a great help to clarity, because —
When you are absolutely clear about what the next step is, your mind feels —
What usually causes lack of clarity?
When you are clear, how do you decide?
What action demonstrates the highest clarity of mind before making a difficult decision?
options: Asking opinions of people that are not related to the matter
Doing what is easiest without considering the consequences

questions.question: A leader is confused and challenged with a tough question in public. What would be the leader's show of clarity at that moment?
options: Reflecting the question, sharing a personal view, and signing off with a key statement

questions.question: You have two assignments due simultaneously. What demonstrates your mental clarity?
options: Prioritizing the work depending on the urgency and the effect
Not doing either and waiting until the last minute

questions.question: You have to pick the next step out of two good options. Which question helps bring clarity?
options: Which one is easier right now?
Which one is in line with my long-term goal?
Which one is more liked by others?
Which one will give me quick praise?

questions.question: Your team asks you to explain a complex concept in simple words. What clarity action comes before communication?
options: Breaking down the idea to one simple, clear sentence

questions.question: What part of your brain helps you structure your thoughts and plans in an understandable manner?
When you identify your feelings accurately, what does your brain do?
What serves as the link between the understanding of something and remembrance?
options: Clarity lets the hippocampus use the facts more

questions.question: The communication in the brain between which two parts, among the others, gets the most improved when a person is making a clear decision?
The hippocampus helps clarity mostly by —
How does organizing your tasks improve clarity?
options: It reduces confusion and shows what matters first

questions.question: How does pausing before making a decision help clarity?
options: Gives time for the brain to focus and sort ideas

questions.question: Which habit improves clarity over time?
options: Writing down key ideas every day

questions.question: Why is taking a short pause helpful when confused?
options: It gives the brain a moment to organize ideas

questions.question: Which sign shows your mind is clear?
options: You keep changing your mind constantly
You can explain your idea simply and calmly

questions.question: Scenario: Your schedule is packed and you feel mentally overwhelmed. What helps maintain clarity?
options: Keep working without a break until everything is done
Decide which tasks are most important and work on only those
Look at social media in order to relax
Skip less important tasks without consideration

questions.question: Scenario: Brainstorming session, everyone talks at once. What is a clear-thinking strategy?
options: Prepare your point, listen to others, and when it is your turn, speak in a calm manner
Loudly say your idea first to be noticed
Ignore the discussion and do not speak your mind
Imitate the idea of someone else

questions.question: Scenario: You are preparing a complex report and realize several data points contradict each other. What's the most clear-thinking approach?
options: Finish the report without paying attention to the contradictions
Point out the contradictions, look into them carefully one by one and then adjust your conclusions
Get help from a colleague to fix the report
Omit this section and save your time

questions.question: Scenario: Receiving conflicting instructions from two senior team members, you are expected to deliver results by the end of the day. What's the most clarity-driven response?
options: Select the simpler one and do it, forget the other
Study the scenarios carefully, check with both members about what should be done first, and devise a plan
Just go ahead and do both without letting anyone know
Give it to someone else to do without letting the boss know

questions.question: Scenario: Two urgent tasks with overlapping deadlines are assigned to you. Both seemed equally important. What is the best way to proceed?
options: I would first do the task that looked easier
Complete them both at the same time to shorten the time period
Determine first which task would have a bigger positive impact in the long run and then focus on it
Do nothing and wait until the manager comes to give you instructions first

questions.question: Observing your surroundings mindfully for 3 minutes improves focus and clarity. Which brain part is most engaged?
Writing a short reflection about your emotions and thoughts strengthens clarity. Which brain part is primarily engaged?
Doing a 2-3 minute "pause and breathe" exercise when stressed improves focus and clarity. Which brain part is mainly activated?
Practicing a short visualization of step-by-step solutions before deciding improves clarity. Which brain part is activated?
Sitting quietly for a few minutes to label your emotions when stressed improves clarity. Which brain part is most engaged?
Clarity as a Culture means:
options: Every person clearly explains the same thought.
The system is not only about clear talking but it also values transparent thinking.
People simplify their communication so that everyone understands without any problem.
In order to prevent confusion, leaders make all the decisions.

questions.question: When you are given a question that you do not understand, a straightforward answer would be:
When someone's point is totally unclear to you, what would be your very first inner reaction?
options: Inquire by asking a question in order to know their exact meaning.
Interpret their meaning according to your own perspective.
Rely on others to explain it first.
In your mind, you simply discard it since it is not clear.

questions.question: The speed with which a good decision is made is not the main factor of its recognition, but rather:
options: The number of people who support it.
The clarity of the explanation of the decision.
The simplicity of the decision implementation.
The self-assurance in the decision presentation.

questions.question: A team member expresses dissent towards your plan just before the deadline. The best decision of the moment would be to:
options: Override their idea with yours to keep the process moving.
Disregard the disagreement and continue with the delivery as planned.
Take a moment to see if their point of view uncovers something you hadn't thought of.
Hold up the project until everyone agrees.

questions.question: Two different mentors provide you with completely contradictory advice regarding your career change. The smartest thing to do would be to:
options: Select the one whose result sounds more impressive.
Go by the one that gives you an emotional support.
See whose advice corresponds with your personal development pattern.
Not make a decision until you have a clear understanding of the situation.

questions.question: One very obvious indication that one's focus is externally directed rather than internally is:
options: It would be your weighing more over the feeling than the looking of things.
The content of your thoughts varies depending on the observer.
You are able to witness your emotional states without any involvement.
It is when you are so absorbed in your work that you do not realize the passing of time.

questions.question: The difference between concentration and inner focus is that:
options: Concentration is an effort from outside; inner focus is an awareness from inside.
Concentration helps to ignore distractions; inner focus acknowledges them.
Inner focus is influenced by surroundings; concentration is not.

questions.question: What most strongly hampers one's inner focus, apart from noise, is:
options: The mind's addiction to the things it sees outside.

questions.question: Real listening is a kind of listening which:
options: You keep quiet until the other person has finished.
You check if they agree with you.
You say their words over again.
You give up your thought of reply while they speak.

questions.question: In a story that has both factual elements and emotional ones, an effective listener would most likely prioritize:
options: Ignoring the feelings and focus on the facts only.
Ignoring the facts and focus on the feelings only.
Recognizing and relating the facts and the feelings.
Using your own experience to judge the story.

questions.question: You are getting advice from a mentor, but the guidance is not making much sense to you. What would be the best listening step in this situation?
options: Just go along with it without questioning because they have the experience.
By asking questions clarify and understand the meaning of the advice.
Pretend that you didn't hear it and trust your own judgment.
Keep it to yourself until another person helps you to understand it.

questions.question: Two team members have a disagreement that they decide to keep to themselves but eventually, it starts affecting the other members of the group. What would be the most intelligent step to do:
options: Talk to each one individually to get their point of view and then act as a mediator together.
Pretend that nothing is happening since it is a personal matter; it will sort itself out.
Organize forcibly a meeting with the entire team to confront the issue immediately.
Recommend everyone to make a compromise without talking about the details.

questions.question: The main part of successful conflict management is:
options: Not having disagreements, at least trying.
Using your opinion to make sure that there will be no more conflicts.
Getting to know the source of the conflict before taking any action.
Deciding that a third party will come to your rescue.

questions.question: A sign of weak conflict handling is:
options: Reacting emotionally and escalating the disagreement.
Acknowledging your own role in the conflict.

questions.question: Systematic thinking is mainly a means to:
options: Solve problems randomly and very fast.
Refrain from thinking too much about the details.
Concentrate solely on the immediate results.
Divide problems into smaller, manageable pieces.

questions.question: Using systematic thinking, it is very important to consider the consequences of each chance because:
options: It gives the assurance that one's personal preferences will be dominant.
It is very helpful to foresee the results and to take the most suitable decision.
The decision-making is made much quicker without any kind of reflection.
The biggest picture can be disregarded.

questions.question: The essential part of planning a team project with limited time and resources is to decide on the most systematical approach:
options: Dividing the work into segments, delegating the tasks, and making a schedule.
Simply doing the tasks you like and expecting others to follow.
Beginning with the simplest tasks and then deciding what to do next.
Giving the team complete freedom without a plan.

questions.question: Are you aware of what you are effectively vocalizing:
options: Loudly as possible to be heard.
Clearly expressing your thoughts and at the same time taking into consideration the context and the impact.
Overpowering the conversations in order to show your point.
Speaking only when it is your turn.

questions.question: Understanding your value in a team or group involves:
options: Avoiding risks to maintain a safe image.
Waiting for others to recognize your worth.
Knowing your strengths and how they contribute to shared goals.

questions.question: Displaying vulnerability in your communication is:
options: Using a mistake or an uncertainty as a way of gaining trust.
Telling your complete life-story, even the things that don't make sense.
Not talking about things that are difficult in order to keep relationships friendly.
Reacting with your feelings, without control, in every situation.

questions.question: What kind of behavior is an example of authentic leadership?
options: Pretending to be competent by using other people's methods.
Managing the situation, showing foresight, and motivating other people by being true to oneself.
Not taking risks and going with the crowd.
Highlighting personal advantage rather than the growth of the team.

questions.question: The difference between a leader and a follower is:
options: Leaders copy the successful methods of others without changing anything.
Followers are the ones who think for themselves whereas leaders just imitate.
Leaders analyze the situation and make a decision based on their understanding and principles.
Leaders try to stay away from giving out tasks so as not to get blamed for mistakes.

questions.question: A leader receives criticism that their methods are unconventional. The most genuine reaction would be:
options: Consider the criticism, change if necessary, but keep being consistent with their own values.
Justify their actions by stubbornly insisting that they are right.
Imitate standard ways of doing things at once to be free from criticism.
Totally disregard the criticism and carry on as previously.

questions.question: If you confront a new situation, what is your first action?
What characteristic feature of a confident person?
A person with self-awareness usually...
Which behavior shows emotional maturity?
options: Reacting fast to defend your view
Speaking louder to win an argument

questions.question: An empathetic person mostly tries to...
Which action supports building a responsible personality?
To grow a resilient personality, a person must...
To strengthen emotional stability, one should...
To build better interpersonal personality, a person should...
Which action best builds integrity?
options: Being honest even in small choices

questions.question: When your values are tested, your true personality shows through your...
A person with a growth mindset believes that...
options: Abilities can be developed through effort

questions.question: To deepen self-leadership, a person must...
options: Wait for others to motivate them

questions.question: When your personal values conflict with external pressure, the best response is to...
options: Stay calm and realign with your inner ethics

questions.question: When building leadership personality, what is the core inner skill?
You have two tasks one urgent, one important. Which one should you finish first to have better long-term clarity?
If before making a choice you always list pros and cons of the options, what kind of decision would it be?
Which of the following is not a part of decision-making?
If you decide to postpone every decision to later, what would be the result over time?
When your mind is a clear decision is made.
You are responsible for selecting one student to be the class representative at a national competition. One of them is very skillful but arrogant; Another one is just average but helpful.
options: Go with the skilled one to ensure a win
Pick the cooperative one for team harmony
Select randomly so that no one gets upset

questions.question: Two of your ideas are equally good. What is the best manner to decide?
options: Get more opinions and compare the results
Go with the option that is easier to implement
Take the decision that your friend prefers

questions.question: You have to choose between two colleges: one close to home but with less exposure, the other is far but with more opportunities.
options: Go with the one that is close to home
Choose the one with more exposure for personal development
Wait until a third alternative comes up

questions.question: You have to pick a project topic within an hour. You very quickly decide the first idea you see online. What kind of decision is this?
You get two job offers: one pays more but would be a source of stress for you; the other will give you balance but with less pay. What should be the main factor in your decision?
options: Your well-being in the long run
What looks to be the easiest way

questions.question: If you are planning and evaluating your future goals, which brain region is most involved?
As a result of your fright, you decide a course of action impulsively. What single part in your brain is responsible for this interaction?
Before choosing your next move, you recall the previous instances. What brain region is your memory?
You gain the ability to perform a bold new decision and furthermore, retain focus. What brain part is your determination?
Under pressure while deciding, you may experience that your body is tensed. What brain system is responsible for this?
Why do quick emotional decisions sometimes fail?
A "good" decision is one that
options: Solves the problem with the least damage

questions.question: When you choose between two snacks - fruit or chips - you are mainly using which skill?
What is the very first step before making any decision?
options: Verify how you feel and what the facts indicate

questions.question: People who decide emotionally will, in most cases, ...
options: Overlook the logical side of things
Work faster and with better accuracy

questions.question: A powerful decision is most likely to be in harmony with ...
Why do people feel stuck while deciding?
options: Too many options and little clarity
They always know the answer already

questions.question: What happens to decision-making when a lot of people give opinions is that it becomes ...
Why do overthinkers struggle with making choices?
options: They come up with the solution too quickly
They spend too much time analyzing each option

questions.question: In case of a high time pressure, what stops wrong decisions?
options: Remaining calm and focusing on the main priorities

questions.question: Two job offers are given to you: one is safe and the other is challenging. What helps you to make a wise decision?
options: Comparing each choice with the long-term goals
Choosing the one that everyone praises
Using a coin to make a decision

questions.question: What will it be if decision-making is delayed repeatedly?
options: You get more clarity without your effort
Opportunities may be lost because of inactivity

questions.question: In a group decision, clarity is lost when—
options: One person dominates without hearing others
All opinions are taken into account

questions.question: What part of a decision chart aids in figuring potential results before taking an action?
What can help in the emotional side of decision-making?
options: Writing down options and logically scoring them
Asking a lot of people for advice

questions.question: In order not to be mixed up, a decision maker should—
options: Asking many people to decide for them

questions.question: An "evaluation step" in a decision flow chart is about—
options: What option brings most overall benefit

questions.question: What is the main goal of "decision mapping"?
options: To help seeing the alternative routes before taking an action
To add more complexity to the problem
To fully rely on the intuition

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: When your attention starts drifting during a task, what's the first smart step to rebuild focus?
options: Switch instantly to another big task
Take a 2-minute mental reset before continuing
Push yourself harder to finish quickly

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: A person reads one paragraph and forgets it immediately. What does this show about their focus state?
options: Their mind is active but scattered

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: Which daily habit helps you stay naturally focused longer?
options: Drinking water only when you feel tired
Checking notifications to refresh the brain
Setting micro-goals for short time slots

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: If you constantly lose focus while studying, which is the most practical solution?
options: Keep the phone close in silent mode
Study in chunks with small breaks

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: What is a clear sign of focused attention?
options: Continuous re-reading of the same line
Losing track of time while working

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: You are preparing a report but your friend keeps talking beside you. What is the most focused response?
options: Politely pause, ask for silence, and refocus
Move to another room after finishing the task

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: In a team meeting, your thoughts wander. What helps bring your attention back effectively?
options: Writing down the next agenda point
Staring at the speaker without reacting
Mentally repeating what the speaker just said

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: You're reading a book, and your phone pings. You feel tempted to check it. What's a focused choice?
options: Check quickly and return to reading
Put the phone away until the chapter ends
Read with one eye on notifications

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: A student finds it hard to focus during online classes. Which method will best train their attention?
options: Keep multiple tabs open for reference

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: You're working on an important project but feel mentally tired. What's the best decision for focus recovery?
options: Drink an energy drink and continue
Scroll through social media to relax

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: What inner skill helps you notice distractions faster before they break your focus?

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: When focus becomes effortless and time feels frozen, what brain state are you in?

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: What does long-term focus practice improve the most in your brain?

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: People who train focus daily are more likely to make decisions that are:

questions.lab: LAB-3: INNER FOCUS IN A NOISY WORLD
questions.question: Why is focused thinking called "mental energy conservation"?

excellent.message: Outstanding! You demonstrate exceptional clarity in thinking and decision-making. Your approach to problems and learning shows advanced human intelligence.

good.message: Great work! You show strong thinking skills and good decision-making abilities. There's room for growth in developing even clearer mental frameworks.

fair.message: You're on the right track! Your thinking shows potential, and with focused development, you can significantly enhance your clarity and decision-making skills.

needs-improvement.message: This is a great starting point! Everyone can develop their thinking skills, and our programs are designed to help you build stronger mental clarity and decision-making abilities.
